str2: In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and tasso; to subordinate; reflexively, to obey.
(including the other inflections); from toi and houtos; truly this, i.e. Of this sort (to denote character or individuality).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: To cooperate with, work together. From sunergos; to be a fellow-worker, i.e. Co-operate.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
